Air Bengawan Solo Terpapar Limbah, Warga Keluhkan Bau Tak Sedap
06 Nov 2019, 05:23 by Mulato Isha'an


Air Bengawan Solo Terpapar Limbah, Warga Keluhkan Bau Tak Sedap

KBRN, Sragen: Warga Sragen yang tinggal di bantaran Sungai Bengawan Solo mengeluhkan bau limbah dan bangkai ikan membusuk beberapa hari terakhir. Pencemaran limbah di Sungai Bengawan Solo dengan warna air hitam pekat menyebabkan ribuan ikan di wilayah Sragen mati. 
Bau tak sedap dari air sungai terpanjang di Pulau Jawa itu, ditambah lagi bau bangkai ikan membusuk yang mati terpapar limbah. Kondisi ini dikeluhkan warga Sragen yang tinggal di sekitar aliran sungai beberapa hari terakhir. 
Lestariyanti (38), warga Dukuh Nglombo, Desa Tenggak, Kecamatan Sidoharjo, Sragen mengatakan kematian ikan terjadi dalam waktu bersamaan dengan kondisi air yang berubah hitam pekat. Banyaknya ikan yang mati dari patin hingga sapu-sapu membuat bau tidak sedap semakin kuat. 
Baunya sudah beberapa hari ini. Banyak ikan yang mati. kami pun juga berhenti mencari pasir karena kalau masuk ke air kulit gatal-gatal,” ungkapnya, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Kepala Dinas Lingkungan Hidup Sragen Samsuri memastikan limbah Bengawan Solo sudah dari hulu, bukan dari industri yang berada di Kabupaten Sragen.  Dengan kondisi air tersebut Pihaknya berharap masyarakat tidak beraktivitas di sungai atau mengkonsumsi ikan dari Bengawan Solo. 
Menurutnya Pemkab Sragen telah mengantisipasi pencemaran Bengawan Solo melalui anak-anak sungai."Limbah hitam itu sudah dari atas sana. Tapi untuk Kabupaten Sragen sudah mengantisipasi tentang pencemaran Bengawan Solo dari anak anak sungainya. Kita verifikasi kita lihat kembali tentang limbah Bengawan Solo itu Pemda sudah meminimalisir limbah yang dari anak sungainya sudah kita antisipasi pencemaran kita kurangi," jelasnya.
Samsuri mengatakan, tidak bisa berbuat banyak dengan kondisi air sungai Bengawan Solo yang semakin mengkhawatirkan ekosistem air tersebut. Karena membutuhkan koordinasi lintas sektoral, bahkan koordinasi menjadi wewenang Provinsi Jawa Tengah. 
Menurutnya Bupati juga sudah melakukan rapat menyikapi pencemaran Bengawan Solo. “Salah satu langkan yang diambil yakni mencegah pencemaran mulai dari hulu, salahsatunya dengan pembangunan instalasi pengolahan limbah (IPAL) komunal.”

Bengawan Solo Water Exposed to Waste, Residents Complained of Bad Odor
Nov 6, 2019, 05:23 by Mulato Isha'an


Bengawan Solo Water Exposed to Waste, Residents Complained of Bad Odor

KBRN, Sragen: Sragen residents who live on the banks of the Bengawan Solo River have complained of the smell of sewage and decaying fish carcasses in the last few days. Waste pollution in the Solo River with the color of black water causes thousands of fish in the Sragen region to die.
The odor from the longest river water on the island of Java, plus the smell of rotting fish carcasses that died of exposure to waste. This condition has been complained by Sragen residents who have lived around the river for the past few days.
Lestariyanti (38), a resident of Nglombo Hamlet, Tenggak Village, Sidoharjo Subdistrict, Sragen, said that fish deaths occurred at the same time as water conditions turned jet black. The number of fish that die from catfish to brooms makes the odor stronger.
It has smelled a few days. Many fish die. we also stop looking for sand because when it enters the itchy skin water, "he said, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
Head of the Sragen Environment Agency, Samsuri, confirmed that the Bengawan Solo waste was from upstream, not from industries in Sragen Regency. With this water condition, his side hopes that the community will not move in the river or consume fish from Bengawan Solo.
According to him, the Sragen Regency Government has anticipated the pollution of Bengawan Solo through tributaries. "The black waste is already from up there. But for Sragen Regency, it has been anticipating about the Bengawan Solo pollution from its tributaries. We will verify that we will look again at the Bengawan Solo waste. we minimize waste from the tributaries we have anticipated to reduce pollution, "he explained.
Samsuri said that he could not do much with the Bengawan Solo river water condition which was increasingly concerned about the water ecosystem. Because it requires cross-sectoral coordination, even coordination is the authority of Central Java Province.
According to him the Regent had also held a meeting addressing the pollution of Bengawan Solo. "One of the balustrades taken is preventing pollution from upstream, one of which is by building a communal waste treatment plant (IPAL)."
